channel.title: Botnet crimes. Is the web coming to an end?
channel.description:
http://www.cbc.ca/news/background/tech/zombie-botnets-2.html
There talking about how Criminals are sending spam emails and viruses with bots and tracking people's Credit card numbers. Some people have already been caught for this and a 21 year old person from california has already been sentenced to 57 months in jail for this crime.

item.title: Botnet crimes. Is the web coming to an end?

Lol speaking from expericence getting caught with a botnet makes you a retard. imho

item.title: Botnet crimes. Is the web coming to an end?
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

Aye, Aye, Captain. Linux may not be the most stable and feature-full OS, but it is the safest OS to use and I’ll take that over some shitty UI any day.

Read full topic
item.source: Botnet crimes. Is the web coming to an end?

item.title: Botnet crimes. Is the web coming to an end?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

People just need to use some common sense. Back when I used to run windows, I didn’t even run a virus scanner, and I have never gotten a virus because I am not an idiot. Now I run linux and am virtually impenetrable by malicious code (the most anything could ever do is delete my home directory, the system would remain untouched)

Bottom line, most of the problem is with windows, microsoft needs to implement a decent multi-user system where a single user can not negatively impact the rest of the system.

Read full topic
item.source: Botnet crimes. Is the web coming to an end?
